commonBlocks.text:
Formerly a car repair workshop, Foundry Mews comprises nine contemporary ground floor studio offices/workspaces and one first floor unit.

The site is in a quiet and secluded position, but just yards from the vibrant Barnes High Street.

The workspaces range from 388 sq ft to 996 square feet. The gated development situated on the site of a former brass foundry offers peace and privacy and yet it is close to all the great amenities that Barnes Village has to offer.

History

An ancient boundary wall is all that's left of a grand riverside house that was once surrounded by open parkland . Latterly a brass foundry the site has had a number of uses over the past 100 years.

Records show it was once a wireless component factory, bookbinders and even a sweet factory. Its last use before we bought the site was as an MOT garage where James Hunt used to sleep off his hangovers.

Purchased in 2012, working with Project Orange Architects we obtained planning permission from LB Richmond for this project in 2013. Charter Construction was appointed on a traditional fully billed Contract completed at the beginning of May 2016 . The site was nominated for several awards and was the winner of The Times best small development Award in 2016

The ten commercial units and seven flats are retained and managed by Marston Properties

Nearest Mainline Stations — Barnes Bridge and Barnes

Nearest Underground Stations — Hammersmith

Nearest Bus Routes — 209, 969, 283, 485 and N22
